name: The Cell Painting Gallery
description: The Cell Painting Gallery is a collection of image datasets created using the Cell Painting assay (or similar); it is maintained by the Carpenter--Singh lab at the Broad Institute.

name: Broad Bioimage Benchmark Collection (BBBC)
description: The Broad Bioimage Benchmark Collection (BBBC) is a collection of freely downloadable microscopy image sets. Each set includes a description of the biological application and 'ground truth' expected results.

name: Image Data Resource (IDR)
description: Public repository of image datasets from published scientific studies.

name: RxRx1
description: A set of 125,514 high-resolution 6-channel fluorescence microscopy images of human cells under 1,108 genetic perturbations in 51 experimental batches. Used for benchmarking batch effect correction, domain adaptation, and transfer learning.

name: RxRx19
description: RxRx19 is the first morphological dataset that demonstrates the rescue of morphological effects of COVID-19.

name: RxRx3
description: A massive dataset of human cells treated with drugs and gene knockouts, bridging the gap between chemical and genetic perturbation space.

name: RxRx3-core
description: A benchmark dataset derived from RxRx3, focused on evaluating representation learning methods.

name: Human Protein Atlas
description: Confocal imaging displaying the location of more than 2/3 of human proteins in cell lines. Raw images or inferred protein subcellular locations can be downloaded.

name: EU OPENSCREEN Bioimage Data
description: High-content imaging dataset from EU-OPENSCREEN, featuring phenotypic profiles of small molecules across multiple screening centers.

name: LIVECell
description: A large-scale, high-quality dataset of phase-contrast microscopy images for label-free cell segmentation and analysis.
